speaker: HUME
text_entry: SCENE III. The palace.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Enter three or four Petitioners, PETER, the Armourer's man, being one

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: My masters, let's stand close: my lord protector

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: will come this way by and by, and then we may deliver

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: our supplications in the quill.

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Marry, the Lord protect him, for he's a good man!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Jesu bless him!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Enter SUFFOLK and QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Here a' comes, methinks, and the queen with him.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: I'll be the first, sure.

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Come back, fool; this is the Duke of Suffolk, and

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: not my lord protector.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How now, fellow! would'st anything with me?

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: I pray, my lord, pardon me; I took ye for my lord

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: protector.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: [Reading]  'To my Lord Protector!' Are your

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: supplications to his lordship? Let me see them:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: what is thine?

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: Mine is, an't please your grace, against John

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: Goodman, my lord cardinal's man, for keeping my

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: house, and lands, and wife and all, from me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thy wife, too! that's some wrong, indeed. What's

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: yours? What's here!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Reads

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: 'Against the Duke of Suffolk, for enclosing the

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: commons of Melford.' How now, sir knave!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Alas, sir, I am but a poor petitioner of our whole township.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: [Giving his petition]  Against my master, Thomas

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Horner, for saying that the Duke of York was rightful

speaker: PETER
text_entry: heir to the crown.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What sayst thou? did the Duke of York say he was

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: rightful heir to the crown?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: That my master was? no, forsooth: my master said

speaker: PETER
text_entry: that he was, and that the king was an usurper.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Who is there?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Take this fellow in, and send for

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: his master with a pursuivant presently: we'll hear

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: more of your matter before the King.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit Servant with PETER

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And as for you, that love to be protected

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Under the wings of our protector's grace,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Begin your suits anew, and sue to him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tears the supplication

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Away, base cullions! Suffolk, let them go.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Come, let's be gone.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: My Lord of Suffolk, say, is this the guise,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is this the fashion in the court of England?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is this the government of Britain's isle,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And this the royalty of Albion's king?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What shall King Henry be a pupil still

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Under the surly Gloucester's governance?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Am I a queen in title and in style,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And must be made a subject to a duke?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I tell thee, Pole, when in the city Tours

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou ran'st a tilt in honour of my love

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And stolest away the ladies' hearts of France,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I thought King Henry had resembled thee

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: In courage, courtship and proportion:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But all his mind is bent to holiness,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To number Ave-Maries on his beads;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His champions are the prophets and apostles,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His weapons holy saws of sacred writ,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His study is his tilt-yard, and his loves

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Are brazen images of canonized saints.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I would the college of the cardinals

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Would choose him pope, and carry him to Rome,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And set the triple crown upon his head:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That were a state fit for his holiness.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, be patient: as I was cause

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your highness came to England, so will I

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In England work your grace's full content.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Beside the haughty protector, have we Beaufort,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The imperious churchman, Somerset, Buckingham,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And grumbling York: and not the least of these

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But can do more in England than the king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And he of these that can do most of all

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Cannot do more in England than the Nevils:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Salisbury and Warwick are no simple peers.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Not all these lords do vex me half so much

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As that proud dame, the lord protector's wife.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She sweeps it through the court with troops of ladies,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: More like an empress than Duke Humphrey's wife:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Strangers in court do take her for the queen:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She bears a duke's revenues on her back,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And in her heart she scorns our poverty:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Shall I not live to be avenged on her?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Contemptuous base-born callet as she is,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She vaunted 'mongst her minions t'other day,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The very train of her worst wearing gown

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was better worth than all my father's lands,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Till Suffolk gave two dukedoms for his daughter.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, myself have limed a bush for her,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And placed a quire of such enticing birds,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That she will light to listen to the lays,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And never mount to trouble you again.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, let her rest: and, madam, list to me;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For I am bold to counsel you in this.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Although we fancy not the cardinal,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet must we join with him and with the lords,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Till we have brought Duke Humphrey in disgrace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As for the Duke of York, this late complaint

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will make but little for his benefit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, one by one, we'll weed them all at last,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And you yourself shall steer the happy helm.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER,  CARDINAL, BUCKINGHAM, YORK, SOMERSET, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and the DUCHESS

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For my part, noble lords, I care not which;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Or Somerset or York, all's one to me.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: If York have ill demean'd himself in France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then let him be denay'd the regentship.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If Somerset be unworthy of the place,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Let York be regent; I will yield to him.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Whether your grace be worthy, yea or no,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Dispute not that: York is the worthier.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The cardinal's not my better in the field.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Warwick may live to be the best of all.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Peace, son! and show some reason, Buckingham,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Why Somerset should be preferred in this.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Because the king, forsooth, will have it so.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, the king is old enough himself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To give his censure: these are no women's matters.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If he be old enough, what needs your grace

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be protector of his excellence?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, I am protector of the realm;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, at his pleasure, will resign my place.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Resign it then and leave thine insolence.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Since thou wert king--as who is king but thou?--

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The commonwealth hath daily run to wreck;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The Dauphin hath prevail'd beyond the seas;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And all the peers and nobles of the realm

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have been as bondmen to thy sovereignty.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: The commons hast thou rack'd; the clergy's bags

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Are lank and lean with thy extortions.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Thy sumptuous buildings and thy wife's attire

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Have cost a mass of public treasury.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Thy cruelty in execution

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Upon offenders, hath exceeded law,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And left thee to the mercy of the law.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: They sale of offices and towns in France,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If they were known, as the suspect is great,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Would make thee quickly hop without thy head.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exit GLOUCESTER. QUEEN MARGARET drops her fan

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Give me my fan: what, minion! can ye not?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She gives the DUCHESS a box on the ear

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I cry you mercy, madam; was it you?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Was't I! yea, I it was, proud Frenchwoman:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Could I come near your beauty with my nails,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: I'd set my ten commandments in your face.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sweet aunt, be quiet; 'twas against her will.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Against her will! good king, look to't in time;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: She'll hamper thee, and dandle thee like a baby:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Though in this place most master wear no breeches,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: She shall not strike Dame Eleanor unrevenged.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Lord cardinal, I will follow Eleanor,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And listen after Humphrey, how he proceeds:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: She's tickled now; her fume needs no spurs,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: She'll gallop far enough to her destruction.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Re-enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, lords, my choler being over-blown

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With walking once about the quadrangle,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I come to talk of commonwealth affairs.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As for your spiteful false objections,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prove them, and I lie open to the law:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But God in mercy so deal with my soul,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As I in duty love my king and country!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But, to the matter that we have in hand:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I say, my sovereign, York is meetest man

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To be your regent in the realm of France.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Before we make election, give me leave

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To show some reason, of no little force,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That York is most unmeet of any man.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I'll tell thee, Suffolk, why I am unmeet:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: First, for I cannot flatter thee in pride;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Next, if I be appointed for the place,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My Lord of Somerset will keep me here,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Without discharge, money, or furniture,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till France be won into the Dauphin's hands:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Last time, I danced attendance on his will

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till Paris was besieged, famish'd, and lost.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That can I witness; and a fouler fact

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Did never traitor in the land commit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Peace, headstrong Warwick!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Image of pride, why should I hold my peace?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Enter HORNER, the Armourer, and his man PETER, guarded

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because here is a man accused of treason:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Pray God the Duke of York excuse himself!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Doth any one accuse York for a traitor?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What mean'st thou, Suffolk; tell me, what are these?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Please it your majesty, this is the man

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That doth accuse his master of high treason:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His words were these: that Richard, Duke of York,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Was rightful heir unto the English crown

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And that your majesty was a usurper.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Say, man, were these thy words?

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: An't shall please your majesty, I never said nor

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: thought any such matter: God is my witness, I am

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: falsely accused by the villain.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: By these ten bones, my lords, he did speak them to

speaker: PETER
text_entry: me in the garret one night, as we were scouring my

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Lord of York's armour.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Base dunghill villain and mechanical,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I'll have thy head for this thy traitor's speech.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I do beseech your royal majesty,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Let him have all the rigor of the law.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Alas, my lord, hang me, if ever I spake the words.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: My accuser is my 'prentice; and when I did correct

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: him for his fault the other day, he did vow upon his

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: knees he would be even with me: I have good

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: witness of this: therefore I beseech your majesty,

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: do not cast away an honest man for a villain's

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: accusation.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Uncle, what shall we say to this in law?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This doom, my lord, if I may judge:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let Somerset be regent over the French,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because in York this breeds suspicion:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And let these have a day appointed them

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For single combat in convenient place,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For he hath witness of his servant's malice:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This is the law, and this Duke Humphrey's doom.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: I humbly thank your royal majesty.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: And I accept the combat willingly.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Alas, my lord, I cannot fight; for God's sake, pity

speaker: PETER
text_entry: my case. The spite of man prevaileth against me. O

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Lord, have mercy upon me! I shall never be able to

speaker: PETER
text_entry: fight a blow. O Lord, my heart!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sirrah, or you must fight, or else be hang'd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Away with them to prison; and the day of combat

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: shall be the last of the next month. Come,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Somerset, we'll see thee sent away.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
